title: Ten Times Happier
author: Owen O'Kane
about: the great tricks to be happier in life.
body:
### Prologue: The Forgotten Realm of Devram
In the star-hidden realm of **Devram**, the gods—known as the Firsts—crafted this world to house their favored descendants, the **Legacies**. Fearful that their children could one day overthrow them, the Firsts forbade return or interference after entrusting Devram to them. To sustain Legacy rule, the gods created the **Fae**, mystical beings bound to serve by supplying their magical lifeblood. Every five years, Fae deemed eligible are summoned for the **Selection**, where they may be chosen as the personal **Source** for one of the six Kingdom Heirs—an honor steeped in both reverence and oppression. This installment marks the first time in millennia all six Heirs select Sources, stirring the precarious balance of power.

### Tessa Asura: The Unlikely Chosen
**Tessalyn Asura**, or Tessa, is a withdrawn, emotionally fragile Fae—forgotten and overlooked. Her only sanctuary lies in obscurity, where she nurtures fragile bonds of friendship and clings to anonymity. She never prepared to be a Source—never even considered it. Yet fate intervenes when she’s unexpectedly marked by **Theon**, heir to the **Arius Kingdom**, embodying endings and darkness. Hard-pressed into servitude, she spirals into fear and resistance, yearning only to escape. Her journey from a reluctant servant to a pivotal force in the realm unfolds with each passing day.

### The Bonding Ritual: Pain, Power, and Resistance
Almost immediately, Tessa tries to flee. Theon catches her, initiating the brutal bonding ritual. He imposes four marks over the span of months—each inflicted with agonizing pain, an emotional crucible shaping their twisted bond. The ordeal crushes Tessa's resolve, fueling fury at Theon while awakening curiosity about her own power. As she wavers between retaliation and survival, her tenuous tolerance of Theon's presence marks the beginning of an unstable connection. The marks serve as both chains and conduits, linking their fates inextricably.

### Arius House: A Prison of Power and Secrets
At Arius House, Tessa is thrust into a world of opulence and surveillance. Theon's family is cold, calculating, and dangerous—his father, Valter, is a master of psychological warfare. Tessa's attempts to assert herself are met with punishment, manipulation, and the ever-present threat of violence. Theon oscillates between protector and jailer, his own trauma shaping his actions. Tessa's resistance is both a survival mechanism and a source of friction, as the bond's demands clash with her need for autonomy. The house itself is a labyrinth of secrets, with Tessa's every move watched and judged.

### The Emerging Ceremony: Unleashing the Storm Within
The Emerging Ceremony is the climax of the Selection year, where Fae receive their elements and the balance of power is tested. Tessa's emergence is a cataclysm: her magic is uncontrollable, manifesting as a storm of light, air, and water that shatters the arena and exposes her as something more than Fae. The Keeper, a mysterious figure, marks her personally, and the realm is thrown into chaos. Her newfound power challenges the very foundation of the world, setting the stage for a reckoning that could reshape Devram forever.

### Betrayal and Blood: The Breaking Point
At the Acropolis, Tessa is confronted with her cruel upbringing: her former den mother oversees her, reigniting past trauma. In a panic, Tessa flees—but is attacked by vampires. Rescued by dragon-shifting Luka and Theon, she still faces punishment: locked in a wine cellar where shards of glass cut her, she returns changed—docile. During a ceremonial trial, a stranger touches her and awakens a deeper truth—Tessa is not Fae by birth, but carries the blood of **Achaz**, one of the ancient gods, igniting unstoppable powers within her. Now, her gaze is set on vengeance.

### The Gods' Game: Manipulation and Destiny
The prologue isn’t alone. In the final scene, two gods converse. One seeks a warrior to traverse worlds and train his daughter. The other warns: any such journey will need the aid of the formidable **Queen of the World Walkers**—hinting Devram’s fate intertwines with far greater realms. These divine machinations set the stage for a cosmic struggle, with Tessa at the center, unknowingly poised to challenge the gods themselves.

### Themes, Conflict & Reader Reactions
- This is a **dark, emotionally charged**, politically fraught fantasy. Themes include servitude, consent, trauma, identity, and resistance.
- Reader responses are intense and polarized:
  > “It feels like it’s been 600 pages of Tessa absolutely copping it from everyone… I feel like it’s been emotionally taxing.”
  > “The bond… probably falls under dubcon… so if that makes you uncomfortable… it’s okay to not keep going.”
  > Others find that character arcs evolve powerfully through subsequent books:
  > “His character probably goes through the most growth… book 3”
  > “I loved this series… Rain of Shadows is a lot better than her previous series… exciting to see author growth.”

### Final Reflections
**Rain of Shadows and Endings** delivers a haunting, intricate narrative: a world forgotten by gods, a fragile heroine whose roots defy her reality, and the corrosive intimacy of power bound by pain. Tessa’s journey—from broken to awakened goddess—sets a foundation as violent as it is transformative. The ending leaves readers questioning loyalties, powerless systems, and whether revenge or redemption will guide her next.

*Note: This book ends on a cliffhanger and serves as opening act to a four-book saga.*

title: Rain of Shadows and Endings
author: Melissa K. Roehrich
about: Melissa K. Roehrich is a dark fantasy romance author based in North Dakota. She lives on a small farmstead with her husband, three boys, and various animals, including dogs, cats, and chickens. Roehrich homeschools her children and dreams of adding goats and ducks to their menagerie. Her writing is characterized by complex characters and intricate world-building. Roehrich maintains an active online presence, engaging with readers through her Facebook group, Discord server, Instagram, and TikTok accounts. Her passion for fantasy is evident in her love for dragons and her constant rearrangement of her bookshelves.
body:
### Origins of Power and Chaos
World built on divine bargains
The world of Devram is born from the chaos of the gods, who create realms, bloodlines, and a delicate balance between light and dark. The First gods, Achaz and Arius, establish order, but their descendants—demigods and their Legacy—inherit a world of power struggles. The Fae are created as a counterbalance, their magic feeding the Legacy, ensuring no bloodline grows too strong. Over centuries, the gods withdraw, leaving their creations to war, love, and betray each other, setting the stage for a society where power, servitude, and trauma are inextricably linked.

### The Selection's Unseen Stakes
Ceremony masks deeper manipulations
Every five years, the Selection brings Fae of age to the Acropolis, where the ruling Legacy heirs choose their Sources—Fae bonded to them, fueling their magic. Tessa, a Fae marked by trauma and a history of being overlooked, expects to remain invisible. But the Selection is more than a ceremony: it's a political chessboard, with heirs, parents, and priestesses maneuvering for advantage. The Arius Heir, Theon, is a wild card—private, powerful, and unpredictable. When he unexpectedly chooses Tessa, the Selection's true stakes are revealed: the cost of being seen, the danger of being wanted, and the beginning of a bond that will upend the balance of power.

### Alcove Encounters and First Impressions
Fateful meeting sparks tension
Tessa's first encounter with Theon is accidental, charged, and laced with the power dynamics of their world. Caught sneaking chocolate, Tessa's irreverence and vulnerability catch Theon's attention. Their exchange is a dance of defiance and submission, setting the tone for their relationship. Theon is both intrigued and frustrated by Tessa's refusal to play the role expected of her. This moment, seemingly trivial, is the spark that leads Theon to select her as his Source, forever altering both their fates.

### Chosen and Claimed
Bonding ritual strips autonomy
Theon's selection of Tessa is a shock to all, especially Tessa herself. The ritual that follows is invasive and painful: Tessa is marked, injected with a magical tonic, and forced to submit through entrancing commands. The first Mark binds her to Theon, making her his Source—his property, his power well, his responsibility. The process is traumatic, both physically and psychologically, and Tessa's resistance is met with the cold machinery of tradition. Theon, for all his power, is as much a prisoner of expectation as she is.

### The Bond's First Mark
Painful magic forges connection
The first Marking is agony for Tessa, a violation that leaves her physically ill and emotionally shattered. Theon, though not cruel, is complicit in her suffering, rationalizing it as necessary. The bond demands closeness, and both are tormented by its pull—Tessa by pain and loss of self, Theon by a need for control and the fear of failure. Their journey to Arius House is a trial of endurance, with Tessa's body and spirit battered by the adjustment to the Mark, and Theon forced to confront the consequences of his choices.

### Resistance and Submission
Struggle for agency within captivity
At Arius House, Tessa is thrust into a world of opulence and surveillance. Theon's family is cold, calculating, and dangerous—his father, Valter, is a master of psychological warfare. Tessa's attempts to assert herself are met with punishment, manipulation, and the ever-present threat of violence. Theon oscillates between protector and jailer, his own trauma shaping his actions. Tessa's resistance is both a survival mechanism and a source of friction, as the bond's demands clash with her need for autonomy.

### Arius House: New Rules
Obedience enforced through pain and isolation
Tessa's life becomes a series of negotiations and consequences. Theon, pressured by his father and his own ambitions, imposes strict rules: obedience, proximity, and silence. Tessa is denied small freedoms—food, comfort, even the right to grieve. Attempts to escape are met with magical tracking, physical restraint, and psychological torment. Yet, moments of genuine connection flicker between them, hinting at the possibility of something more than servitude. The house itself is a labyrinth of secrets, with Tessa's every move watched and judged.

### The Cost of Obedience
Punishment, trauma, and fleeting comfort
Theon's efforts to "care" for Tessa are tainted by the power imbalance between them. Punishments are severe—confinement, deprivation, and magical pain. Yet, in rare moments, Theon's humanity surfaces: he tends to her wounds, offers comfort after nightmares, and reveals his own scars. Tessa, battered by the relentless demands of the bond and the cruelty of the Arius household, learns to survive by giving just enough to avoid the worst consequences, while secretly plotting for freedom.

### The Games of Legacy
Political intrigue and dangerous alliances
As the Selection year unfolds, the true nature of Devram's politics is revealed. Theon is drawn into a web of alliances, betrayals, and power plays, with Tessa as both pawn and prize. Other heirs, their Sources, and the ruling families maneuver for advantage, each with their own secrets and agendas. Theon's plans for the future—overthrowing his father, seizing control of the Underground, and reshaping the realm—depend on Tessa's power and loyalty. Tessa, meanwhile, is forced to navigate a world where every kindness is suspect and every alliance is a potential threat.
.
### The Wild and Untamed
Secrets of bloodlines and forbidden magic
Tessa's true nature is a mystery even to herself. Hints of forgotten bloodlines, hidden powers, and divine heritage surface as she struggles to control her emerging magic. Theon and his allies—Luka, a dragon-shifter Guardian, and Axel, his brother—reveal their own secrets, including bargains with witches and the existence of the Underground, a prison for the realm's most dangerous beings. Tessa's power is unlike any seen before, a blend of light and darkness, storm and fury. The gods themselves watch from afar, their own plans unfolding.

### The Emerging Ceremony
Power revealed, world upended
The Emerging Ceremony is the climax of the Selection year, where Fae receive their elements and the balance of power is tested. Tessa's emergence is a cataclysm: her magic is uncontrollable, manifesting as a storm of light, air, and water that shatters the arena and exposes her as something more than Fae. The Keeper, a mysterious figure, marks her personally, and the realm is thrown into chaos. Theon's plans are jeopardized, and the other kingdoms move to claim or destroy Tessa, fearing what she represents.

### Storm Unleashed
Magic, memory, and the fight for self
Tessa's power is both a blessing and a curse. She is hunted, captured, and manipulated by those who would use her for their own ends. The Achaz Lord, Rordan, reveals that Tessa is not Fae, but something older and more powerful—a forgotten daughter of the gods, a storm incarnate. Her memories, traumas, and desires collide as she struggles to control her magic and claim her identity. Theon, desperate to protect her, is forced to confront his own darkness and the limits of his control.

### The Price of Secrets
Betrayal, bargains, and the cost of survival
Secrets unravel: Tessa's bloodline, the true nature of the Source bond, and the bargains made by Theon and his allies. Betrayals cut deep—friends become enemies, and allies demand impossible sacrifices. Theon's father exacts a terrible price for failure, killing those closest to Theon and Tessa. Theon, in turn, is forced to choose between his ambitions and his growing feelings for Tessa. The cost of survival is steep, and both must decide what they are willing to sacrifice for power, freedom, and each other.

### Blood, Betrayal, and Bargains
Death, punishment, and the breaking point
Theon's failures culminate in tragedy: the death of Pen, the beloved Fae caretaker, and the shattering of trust between him and Tessa. In a moment of rage and despair, Theon locks Tessa in a wine cellar, triggering her deepest traumas and breaking her spirit. The aftermath is a reckoning for both: Tessa is left numb and hollow, her power barely contained, while Theon is forced to confront the monster he has become. Bargains are struck, but the price is always blood.

### The Breaking and the Bond
Destruction leads to transformation
Tessa's time in the cellar is her crucible. She emerges broken, her soul shattered, but in the emptiness finds a strange freedom. No longer trying to please or resist, she becomes unpredictable, wild, and untamed. Theon, realizing the depth of the damage he has caused, is both terrified and drawn to her. Their bond, once a chain, becomes something else—a connection forged in pain, desire, and mutual recognition of the darkness within. Together, they are more than the sum of their parts, but the world is not ready for what they have become.

### The Keeper's Mark
Divine intervention and new destiny
The Keeper's appearance at the Emerging Ceremony is a turning point. Tessa is marked not as Fae, but as something other—her power is a storm, a force of nature that cannot be contained by the old rules. The gods, watching from their hidden realms, take notice. Tessa's destiny is no longer to serve, but to challenge the very foundations of Devram. Theon, for all his ambition, is swept up in her wake, forced to choose between love and power, control and chaos.

### Light Against Darkness
Revelation of true power
Tessa's magic is revealed to be a blend of light and darkness, storm and shadow—a legacy of both Achaz and Arius, and perhaps something more. She is hunted by all, desired by many, but belongs to none. Theon's attempts to control her are futile; together, they are a force that can either save or destroy the realm. The old order trembles, and the balance of power is forever altered.

### The Forgotten Daughter
Claiming identity, rewriting fate
Tessa learns the truth of her origins: she is the forgotten daughter of gods, hidden in Devram for a purpose. Her power is not a curse, but a gift—one that can reshape the world. Theon, Luka, and Axel become her unlikely allies, each with their own scars and secrets. Together, they must navigate a world on the brink of chaos, where every choice has consequences and every secret is a weapon.

### Chaos Ascendant
A new storm rises
As the book closes, the gods themselves move their pieces. Tessa, once nothing, is now the wild and untamed storm that can tip the balance between light and dark, life and death. Theon, once a would-be conqueror, is now her equal and her partner in chaos. The old world is ending, and a new one is being born—one where the forgotten, the broken, and the wild will decide the fate of all.
